translation.en: -(Swat 1) Get down! Get down! -(All yelling)
(Swat 2) Don't move!
FBI! Don't move!
Get down! Get down!
(Swat 3) Where are the hostages? Where are the hostages?
(Swat 4) FBI, Police! Don't move! (Swat 3) Down! Stay down!
(Swat 2) Cross your legs! Cross your legs and put your hands in the air!
(Swat 4) Police! Don't move! Police! Don't move! Get down! Get down!
-(Kate) Clear! -Police! Search warrant. Don't move!
-Steppin' out! -(Swat 5) Police, don't move!
Police, don't move! Search warrant!
(Kate) FBI!
(Man) Are you hit?
I'm good.
Fuck!
(Swat 2) Front room, clear!
(Kate) Team leader! Status?
(Swat 6) Front clear! (Leader) We're clear, ma'am!
Two suspects in custody!
-(Reggie) You OK, Macer? -Yeah.
Why'd he shoot? There's no one here.
(Reggie) Whoa.
What the fuck?
-(Kate) Jesus! -(Retching)
Those weren't our hostages.
No. That was something else.
-(Leader) Macer? -Yeah?
U.S. Attorney wants a statement. What do you want me to say to her?
The truth.
Looks like Sonora...
Yeah.
How many total?
We've got 15 in this hall here, about 20 in the back bedroom.
We haven't even checked the attic or under the crawl space.
Call DOJ, let 'em know what we have.
This one of the houses owned by Manuel Diaz?
No way to connect him, but he owns it.
Jesus Christ.
Reg, step out. It's OK.
(Officer) Vickers! I need bolt cutters!
Vickers!
(Jennings) PD found something.
(Softly) Relax.
Relax.
(Male newsreader) Such a heavy body count this close to Phoenix
translation.ko: 피닉스 근교에서 발생한 대참사에서 볼 수 있듯이

translation.en: is without a doubt a major escalation for the cartels.
There will be pressure in Washington to explain how such a dramatic outrage
translation.ko: 이런 잔악한 사건이 미국 중심부에서 벌어짐에 따라 정부는 해명 요구에 시달릴 것으로 보입니다

translation.en: could happen so deep inside the American heartland.
translation.ko: 정부는 해명 요구에 시달릴 것으로 보입니다

translation.en: We may be talking about the victims of a turf war
or maybe some illegal immigrants who are tied to a ransom,
translation.ko: 몸값을 노린 납치로 보일 수도 있지만

translation.en: but it will be some weeks before we have a clearer picture on who the victims...
(Inaudible)
(Reggie) What's goin' on?
I have no idea.
(Jennings) She's been leading our kidnap response team for three years.
Put her through the grinder since she got here, and she hasn't blinked.
She's in the front line.
Nobody's gonna be happier than Kate to see these guys go down.
So she's a thumper.
Today was her fifth O.I.S.
(Matt) 5-and-0, not bad for a rookie.
She never worked cases?
Been kicking doors since day one.
I like her already. What about the partner? He seen any action?
He's only been with us 18 months.
What's his background?
He's a sharp kid.
ROTC scholarship to Maryland,
did a tour in Iraq, got his law degree from UNC.
translation.ko: 이라크 파병도 갔었고 법학 학위도 있네

translation.en: -He's green, but he's good. -(Matt sighs)
No lawyers on this train. Just give me the girl.
We did this by the book, right?
Come on, of course.
-Jesus. -What?
Oh, shit.
Would you step in here, Kate?
Quite a find today, the loss of two officers notwithstanding.
Yes, sir.
How familiar are you with Manuel Diaz's operation?
His company, Sun Oasis, has 80 or so foreclosure properties.
translation.ko: 압류 부동산 사업을 크게 하고 있고

translation.en: He has other legitimate businesses. Um...
But he's rumoured to be linked with one of the Mexican cartels.
(Burnett) Manuel Diaz works for the Sonora Cartel.
He's most likely their senior member in the United States.
(Matt) What do you know about his brother?
I wasn't aware he had one.
Guillermo. His brother's name is Guillermo.
Do you know anything about his cousin?
I didn't know he had one of those either. None of that is in his file.
His cousin is Fausto Alarcon.
I don't know who that is.
No one does. He's off the grid.
(Burnett) He's number three in the Sonora Cartel.
This is not my department, sir.
Like I said, Agent Macer doesn't work narcotics.
She runs a kidnap response team.
Are you married?
Am I married?
Do you have a husband?
Divorced.
Kids?
No.
Anything else?
No. Thanks, Kate. If you could wait outside, please.
-Well? -I have no clue.
(Reggie) Who are those people? You know?
(Kate) No idea.
(Burnett) Thanks for coming in, guys.
(Phil clears throat) Will you come back in, Kate?
DOJ wants advisors that focus on cartels involved in pursuing Mr Diaz.
translation.ko: 디아스 추적 건으로 법무부에서 고문을 요청했네

translation.en: This is Matt Graver. He'll be leading the team.
translation.ko: 저쪽은 맷 그레이버 이 팀의 팀장이지

translation.en: (Kate) Isn't this Phoenix homicide now?
No, we're expanding the scope of the investigation a bit.
translation.ko: 사건 조사 규모를 좀 키우기로 했어

translation.en: You'll act as a liaison.
What does that mean?
They need an agent with tactical experience, like you.
translation.ko: 자네처럼 전술 경험이 풍부한 요원이 필요해

translation.en: State Department is pulling an agent from the field
that specialises in responding to escalated cartel activity.
You'll be part of the team.
You'll meet up with them at Luke, uh, tomorrow?
-(Matt) Day after. Early. -Air Force Base?
translation.ko: 그다음 날입니다, 일찍요 공군 기지 말입니까?

translation.en: Yeah, we're gonna go see Guillermo.
Diaz's brother?
That's the one.
Where is he?
Uh, he's in the El Paso area.
What's our objective?
To dramatically overreact.
Kate, you must volunteer for an inter-agency task force.
translation.ko: 케이트 이번 임무는 자원자만 갈 수 있네

translation.en: Think very hard before you respond.
You wanna be a part of this?
Do we get an opportunity at the men responsible for today?
translation.ko: 오늘 사건의 범인을 잡을 수 있습니까?

translation.en: The men who were really responsible for today, yeah.
I'll volunteer.
(Boy) Papa!
(Both speaking Spanish) Wake up
We need to go to my soccer match
You play soccer?
Si.
You're sure?
No.
(Speaking Spanish) Yes, Dad, we have to
Ok, let's go
Mama, make coffee and eggs for Papa
translation.ko: 엄마, 아빠 먹게 커피랑 달걀 해 줘

translation.en: (Speaking Spanish) Yes, my love
(Reggie) You keep an eye on that doughy prick -with the flip-flops. -(Scoffs)
Don't trust him.
How you doin', sir?
I.D.'s?
She's on the list, but you're not.
Well, what's she supposed to do?
I need you to turn this around for me.
It's fine. It's good.
I'll call you when we're headed back.
-All right. -(Car door closes)
-Morning. -Morning. Am I late?
No, no, no. We just landed. Come on, this way.
My bird dog over there, Alejandro.
Are we taking this?
Yeah. Only the best for you.
DOD flies you around in private jets now?
Yeah. You guys don't have one of these?
Right.
Is there any food on this flight?
Uh, there's some bitchin' peanuts in the back. But it's kind of a self-serve deal.
translation.ko: 뒤에 땅콩인지 뭔지 있는데 여긴 셀프야

translation.en: (Kate) Kate Macer.
Have you been to Juárez before?
No, I... We're goin' to El Paso, right?
translation.ko: 아뇨 우리 엘패소 가는 거 맞죠?

translation.en: (Groggily) Yeah, amazing. OK.
Are you OK?
Yeah. I'm fine.
So, um...
So this is your speciality?
The cartels in Mexico are your speciality?
Yeah. Yeah.
Is there anything I should know?
Uh, you're asking me how a watch works.
For now, let's just keep an eye on the time.
OK.
How you doin'?
(Steve) Howdy! How you been?
(Matt) Good, buddy. How you feelin'?
Well, when I pee, it burns.
translation.ko: 좀 어때? 오줌 쌀 때 죽겠어

translation.en: (Matt) Maybe it's gonorrhoea.
What colour is it?
(Steve) Yellow with red specks.
(Matt) Red specks or blood?
(Matt) I'm tryin' to get DOD to let me look into this conspiracy to sink Fiji.
(Steve) Fiji? (Matt) Yeah.
(Steve) Leave Fiji alone, terrorists!
(Matt) Yeah. Exactly. I figure a month or two over there, we'll get it all worked out.
translation.ko: 그러게, 한두 달이면 우리가 해결할 수 있는데

translation.en: So who's goin' over there today?
Marshals, DEA... I pulled a team for you, Matt.
Oh, man, I love it when you say "a team". It makes me all warm and fuzzy.
(Steve) Oh, they're a crack bunch, too. Just rotated back from Afghanistan.
(Matt) Wow. Where's everybody linking up?
(Steve) A.I.C.
(Matt) Good, good, good.
(Man) Mexican Federal Police will meet you at the border
and proceed with you to the courthouse, located here.
translation.ko: 이곳 법원까지 함께 이동한다 "멕시코 연방 법원"

translation.en: This is a high-level target.
The most likely spots for an attempt will be at the exchange
and at the border crossing on the return.
The Marshals will enter...
Kevin, Keith, you wanna stand up?
Now, the Marshals' response team is in Laredo...
Love Texans.
So our friends from Delta have volunteered to come along
and will escort the Marshals on the exchange.
And here's the man of the hour.
You comin' with or waitin' here?
We'll take the tour with you. Loan us a couple pop guns.
translation.ko: 관광할 겸 가 보지 총 좀 빌려줘

translation.en: All right, this is turning into an all-star affair!
Keith, you want another hand on the exchange?
(Keith) You sober?
Will be by the time we get there.
Got a bottle in the truck in case your hands get shaky.
(Matt) I know I could always count on you, Keith.
(Man) All right, we'll gear you up as soon as we're done here.
Now, Matt, you can be the tip of the spear, and we don't have to rob a guy from Delta.
translation.ko: 그럼 맷이 팀 선두에 서 줘

translation.en: Now, be careful on the turnaround.
If the Federale's a shooter, it's gonna happen on the turnaround.
Delta's Team One will be the lead vehicle.
We can divide Team Two between the carry car and the trail vehicle. That OK?
translation.ko: 2팀은 호송차와 최후방으로 나눈다 "브리지 오브 더 아메리카"

translation.en: Good. Now, Delta, if you can identify yourselves
so everyone knows who to hide behind if shit hits the fan.
The most likely spot for a hit will be at the border crossing on the return.
translation.ko: 복귀하는 길 국경에서 공격당할 확률이 높다

translation.en: Anywhere along the way, anyone not in this room is a potential shooter.
The op isn't over until we get back here.
OK?
Be alert. Be vigilant. And be aware. Let's go.
What?
(Keith) Hey! I thought you were in prison.
-(Ranger) They took me out. -(Laughs)
(Ranger) They needed somebody for this job.
(Keith) For good behaviour or bad behaviour?
Have you ever been over there?
I worked in Juárez.
For the DEA?
No.
For who?
For Mexico.
I was a prosecutor.
-You're not American? -No.
Who do you work for now?
Oh, I go where I'm sent.
Where were you sent from?
Cartagena.
Colombia.
Listen...
Nothing will make sense to your American ears.
translation.ko: 댁들 미국인들 눈엔 우리가 하는 일이...

translation.en: And you will doubt everything that we do.
But in the end,
you will understand.
Here, try this on. See if it fits.
Is he CIA? Are you?
He's a DOD advisor, just like me.
No, he's not.
Just pay attention to Alejandro and if he says to do somethin', just do it.
translation.ko: 저 친구가 뭐라든 하라는 대로 해

translation.en: I'm not authorised to follow orders from Alejandro!
translation.ko: 난 알레한드로의 명령 따를 이유 없어요

translation.en: Especially in Mexico!
Fine. Then stay here.
But you don't want to, do you?
I just wanna know what I'm getting into.
Kate, you volunteered to get on this train because you know
you're doing nothing in Phoenix.
Yeah, you're just sweeping up a fucking mess.
In six months, every single house you raid will be rigged with explosives.
translation.ko: 6개월 후면 단속 나가는 집마다 폭탄이 설치돼

translation.en: Do you want to find the guys responsible? Yes or no?
Yes.
-Yes? -Yes!
This is where we start.
Try it on.
(Steve) There she is.
The beast.
Juárez.
You know,
1900s, President Taft went to visit President Diaz.
Took 4,000 men with him.
And it almost was called off.
Some guy had a pistol.
Was gonna walk right up to Taft and just blow his brains out.
translation.ko: 태프트 앞까지 가서 총을 쏘려 했거든

translation.en: But it was avoided. 4,000 troops!
Think he felt safe? (Scoffs)
Welcome to Juárez.
It's brilliant what they do.
When they mutilate a body like that,
they make people think they must have been involved,
they must have deserved such a death cos they did something.
Oh, it's brilliant what they do.
(Steve) You hear that?
Those aren't firecrackers.
(Matt on radio) Mexicans are adjusting our route.
There's activity ahead, we need to go around. Everyone hold on.
Nothing will happen here.
They try anything, it will be at the border.
Keep an eye out for the State Police.
They're not always the good guys.
Spotter vehicle, left lane. Left lane!
(Man 1 on radio) Spotter vehicle, nine o'clock.
(Steve) I'm gettin' a boner.
(Man 1) Is that one of ours?
Watch the right, watch the right.
(Matt) No, that's a lone wolf.
(Man 1) Eyes on rooftops.
(Man 2) Nothing.
Rooftops clear.
(Pilot on radio) Bridge is one klick out. Road is clear. Hotfoot it, gentlemen.
(Matt) Everyone stay in this lane. Our agents at the border are
translation.ko: 현재 차선 유지하라 국경에 있는 요원들이

translation.en: waving traffic through to get us over as quickly as they can.
(Man 1) Everyone stay frosty.
(Man 2) OK, it's a fuck-up. What are we gonna do now?
(Pilot) Here's the deal, a car broke down up ahead.
It's being sorted out, but it's gonna take a while. Stand by.
translation.ko: 오래 걸릴 것 같다 대기하기 바란다

translation.en: Get your service weapon out.
Red Impala, two lanes over, on my ten.
Copy that. Red Impala, two lanes left.
(Man 1) Roger that.
Three lanes left. Seven o'clock. Green Civic.
Bring your window down.
(Alejandro) Gun.
Gun. Gun left!
(Matt) What are the rules here?
(Man 1) We must be engaged to engage.
(Man 2) Permission to get out of the vehicle and set a perimeter?
(Man 1) Stay in your vehicle. You can do what they do. If they get out, you get out.
(Man 2) Get ready. They can see our lane clearing.
If it's coming, it's coming now.
(Man 1) Move! (Kate) Wait, wait, wait.
Get outta the car.
Jesus Christ!
(Delta leader) Don't move! Cálmate!
No, no, no, no!
(Speaking Spanish) In peace, in peace
Put down the gun
Do you want to die?
What the fuck are we doing?
Fuck!
(Delta 1) Lane's clear! The lane's clear!
(Delta leader) Don't look at me!
Put your hands behind your head! Go! Hands behind your head!
(Delta 2) All clear! (Delta 3) I got this!
Go, go, go!
(Delta leader) Move, move, move!
(Man 2 on radio) This is gonna be on the front page of every newspaper in America.
(Steve chuckles) No, it won't. It won't even make the papers in El Paso.
Clear!
(Matt) Got a little nutty, huh?
(Kate) Nutty? Yeah. Yeah, that was fucking illegal.
You wanna start a war? You're a fucking spook!
translation.ko: 전쟁 일으키고 싶어요? 당신네 CIA는 미쳤어

translation.en: And him! I mean, who the fuck is that?
Told you, you could stay here.
Jesus Christ. Jesus Christ. You just spray bullets at...
Yeah, sure there's just fucking civilians everywhere.
I'm not a soldier! This is not what I do!
translation.ko: 난 군인도 아니고 이런 짓 못 해요

translation.en: Whoa! Don't sell yourself short, all right?
translation.ko: 난 군인도 아니고 이런 짓 못 해요 자네를 과소평가하지 마

translation.en: The reason Reggie's home is I know he wasn't ready for this.
translation.ko: 레지는 감당할 준비가 안 됐기 때문에 제외된 거야

translation.en: But he better get ready real quick because this is the future, Kate!
translation.ko: 그놈도 준비해야 해 이게 다가올 일이니까!

translation.en: Juárez is what happens when they dig in. This is it!
What am I doing here?
What you're doing here is you're giving us the opportunity
to shake the tree and create chaos. That's what this is!
In the meantime, just sponge everything up you see.
Learn! That's why you're here.
Guillermo...
You're giving him a belly full of water, you devil.
You didn't think we'd get you here, did you?
I love it when they no hablo Inglés.
You know, I brought an old buddy of yours.
I bet you hablo to him. Yeah.
(Rafael) I didn't know ghosts got thirsty.
I know someone kept him alive for us.
I doubt it was easy.
What's easy these days?
I'm sorry about what happened on the return. I control only what I can.
translation.ko: 공격당한 건 유감이야 나도 손을 못 썼어

translation.en: (Speaking Spanish) (In English) It's not your fault.
(Both speaking Spanish) How is your wife?
translation.ko: 제수씨는 어때? 잘 지내, 아들도 둘 있고

translation.en: She's well -- we have 2 boys
6 and 8 years old
In Juarez?
No, Monterey
-Much better -It's more peaceful
Sí.
There's rumours of a tunnel.
Fausto's main road into Arizona.
If you're doing what I think you're doing, that's the best place to cross.
If you can find it. But time is against you.
translation.ko: 장담은 못 하지만 시간이 많진 않아

translation.en: In three days, nobody will be where they are today.
Shall we?
No, it's better if you don't.
Something happens in that room,
it's easier to say you didn't see anything.
translation.ko: 아무것도 못 봤다고 말하는 게 편하지

translation.en: (Both speaking Spanish) It's great to see you're still in the fight
I'm sorry for what happened to you
Take care
Aw, Alejandro, I think he remembers you.
(Steve) I'm gonna step out.
Timmy.
(Speaking Spanish) Now you'll learn what's hell in Yankee land
translation.ko: 양키 땅이 얼마나 지랄 맞은지 느껴 봐

translation.en: (Guillermo speaking Spanish) No, Medellín
What do you keep lookin' at me for?
No hablo Inglés, remember?
translation.ko: 영어 못 한다며, 기억 안 나?

translation.en: Can I have one of those?
Thank you.
-You like fireworks? -Huh?
Wanna see something cool?
Come on.
Here we go.
Look right there.
(Kate) Unbelievable.
(Man) That's what happens when you chop the head off a chicken.
translation.ko: 닭 모가지를 자르면 저 꼴이 나요

translation.en: -(Kate) Yeah. -(Sirens wailing)
I can see.
(Matt) Can you get 'em all in one place?
We just landed back in Phoenix. I'm on a clock, I can't wait.
translation.ko: 방금 피닉스에 도착해서 꾸물댈 시간이 없어

translation.en: All right, look, contact Bob Fisks. Have him hold 'em in the staging area.
Yeah. How long does it take to get to Tucson?
(Kate) Um, from here it's a little over two hours.
All right. We'll be there around 2:00. Yeah.
(Kate) Are we going to Tucson?
Yeah, you gotta learn how to sleep on a plane.
translation.ko: 그래, 비행기에서 자는 법을 배워 둬

translation.en: They let me on the base when you need a ride, don't they?
You OK?
-She's fine. -(Reggie) I didn't ask you.
And yet I answered.
(Whispers) Kate,
who's that?
We're goin' to Tucson.
(Bob) What's the deal, Matt? Why you holdin' up my transport?
(Matt) Don't worry, Bob. We'll be quick.
How's the auditor gonna react to an $8,000 cheque to fuckin' Domino's Pizza?
translation.ko: 피자값 8천 달러 나오면 감사관한테 쌍욕 먹어

translation.en: Don't be so dramatic, OK? This is Kate Macer with the FBI.
This is her partner, what's-his-name. It was her call.
Yeah, it wasn't my call. Have you got another one of those?
Finish it before you get up there.
No problem.
Hey, Kate.
Tell me what happened in El Paso.
We weren't in El Paso. We were in Mexico.
(Bob) I guess we're not following any procedures.
What do you wanna do?
We want to talk to the people caught around the Nogales area.
OK. That group.
This group here. And that group.
OK. They stay and the rest can go.
(Bob) Josef!
(Speaking Spanish)
(Josef speaking Spanish) Everyone from Nogales, groups A, D, E
Groups A, D, E Stay seated
translation.ko: A, D, E 그룹은 앉아 있도록

translation.en: Everyone else to the buses
Now
(Bob) On the bus. Ándale.
(Josef speaking Spanish) Now!
What are we looking for?
Just keep watching.
(Alejandro speaking Spanish) From this group here
Who has been in the US before?
Excuse me
Where?
-(Man 1) In Arizona. -Arizona.
(Both speaking Spanish) Are you married?
Yes, sir
Any children?
(Man 1) Sí.
Where?
Chihuahua
Let me see your hands
Do you have any tattoos?
No, sir
No?
And you, what's your name?
(Man 2 speaking Spanish) Alejandro
Last name?
Alejandro Rodriguez
And where have you been?
In Texas
And where have you been?
-(Man 1) Arizona. -Arizona...
Talk to me. What are we doing?
I don't have any answers for you.
Let's get some, then.
Do you think I haven't asked these questions? Do you think you can do better?
translation.ko: 난 안 물어봤겠어? 넌 다를 거 같아?

translation.en: -Yeah. -Go ahead.
Matt, can we talk for a minute?
What's up?
Everything OK?
You look very serious.
There's "in the dark" and there's the way you're treating us.
I want to know the objective or I walk, period.
Then go. I didn't ask you to be here. She did.
translation.ko: 그럼 그만둬, 내가 안 불렀어 케이트가 불렀지

translation.en: I walk, too.
-(Matt) What do you wanna know? -Everything.
Fuckin' lawyers.
All right.
Guillermo
told us about a tunnel east of Nogales, near Sasabe.
translation.ko: 노갈레스 쪽에 있는 땅굴 얘기를 하더군

translation.en: Now we're tryin' to find out what areas near there migrants avoid
so we can find the tunnel.
-That better? -(Reggie) And Guillermo is...
Guillermo, he just told you where the drug tunnel is?
-He just told you? -Guillermo didn't have any other options.
translation.ko: 기예르모가 순순히 불었다고요? 그놈도 방법이 없었어

translation.en: We send him back across the border, he's a dead man.
Now he gets to spend the next 30 years in an American prison,
translation.ko: 그나마 미국 감옥에서는 30년간 살 수 있지

translation.en: in relative safety. (Reggie) Just tell us the truth, man.
We are gonna make enough noise
that Manuel Diaz is called back to Mexico to see his boss.
That's the truth.
(Reggie) And then?
And then we know where his boss is.
His name is Fausto Alarcon. El Verdugo.
Every day across that border,
people are kidnapped or killed by his hand or with his blessing.
To find him would be like discovering a vaccine.
translation.ko: 그놈을 찾아내는 건 백신 발견과도 같아요

translation.en: You understand the value of that.
All right, we're good. Just don't keep us in the dark.
translation.ko: 알았어요 앞으로는 이렇게 확실히 밝혀 줘요

translation.en: Great!
You afraid of the dark?
(Matt) Hey!
It's been a humdinger of a day. Go home. Get some rest.
translation.ko: 오늘 고생했어 집에 가서 쉬어 우린 따로 갈 테니까

translation.en: We'll find our own ride. We'll see you tomorrow!
translation.ko: 집에 가서 쉬어 우린 따로 갈 테니까 내일 보자고

translation.en: I just drove a hundred fucking miles.
(Kate) It's a fucking blessing, trust me.
translation.ko: 저렇게 가는 게 다행인 줄 알아

translation.en: Got you smokin' again?
Yeah.
(Reggie) Who the fuck's Guillermo?
(Speaking Spanish) Come and eat. Let's get ready for school
Where's Dad?
He's working
When's he back?
Don't know
Gotta get you a new bra, woman.
The list of things I need.
I'm just saying, you know. Some nice lacy somethin'.
It's been a while since someone's seen me in a bra, except you.
translation.ko: 브래지어 보여 준 남자도 너 빼면 가물가물해

translation.en: Oh, God, don't look at me like that. I don't want your pity.
How was seeing Evan the other day?
I don't know...
-Miss him? -Ask me something else.
You know, I used to see guys like Matt in Iraq. Gotta be careful around these people.
translation.ko: 맷 같은 사람은 조심하는 게 좋아요

translation.en: CIA's not supposed to work this side of the fence.
(Kate) He's a DOD advisor.
You really believe that?
You need somebody watching your six, cos I promise you they aren't.
You know,
we're not even scratching the surface doing what we're doing.
And they are.
Mmm. Well, you sure picked the motherfuckers to show us.
translation.ko: 저쪽은 안 그렇고 비교할 놈들을 제대로 고르셨네

translation.en: What's the password?
Moron.
(Both speaking Spanish)
Los Caballeros, can you cross there?
translation.ko: 그래서 넘을 수는 있어요? 넘을 수는 있는데

translation.en: (Speaking Spanish) You can
translation.ko: 넘을 수는 있는데 그쪽 밀수꾼들 질이 안 좋아요

translation.en: But the coyotes there are crooked
translation.ko: 그쪽 밀수꾼들 질이 안 좋아요 여자는 절대 못 넘어요

translation.en: No women can cross there
(Speaking Spanish) This is our spot.
-(All) No way! No, no. -(Man laughing)
(Man 1 speaking Spanish) This is drug land
The only people who cross there are mules and pollos
It keeps Border Patrol away
Never cross where there are tunnels
You know this area?
translation.ko: 그쪽 좀 알아요? 옛날에는 밀입국하기 제일 좋은 곳이었죠

translation.en: (Man 1 speaking Spanish) For years it was the best place to cross
Here you can walk easily to Highway 86
There is water and shade -Are you getting this? -Mmm-hmm.
(Speaking Spanish) Can you mark the trail to the tunnel?
They hide the entrance behind an old car
Look, right here
Sí.
(Alejandro) That's our way across.
So Guillermo was tellin' the truth.
It's gonna be a good day.
Hey, Kate. Got any friends at Phoenix SWAT?
translation.ko: 케이트 피닉스 SWAT에 친구들 좀 있어?

translation.en: Uh, yeah, we use them in breaches all the time.
Good, cos we're gonna need their help.
What for?
We are gonna fuck with Manuel Diaz's wallet.
(Matt) This is our Smurf, guys. Blonde hair, white purse.
-You know the Heimlich? -(Jessie) Oh, yeah.
She tries to eat that deposit receipt, you Heimlich it right out of her, hear me?
translation.ko: 예금 증서 삼키면 바로 뱉게 만들어요

translation.en: Copy that.
There she goes. All right, go get 'em, tiger.
Take 'em.
(Jessie) Hold still! Hold still!
You want bank computers for evidence?
No, no. Just the money. But freeze all his accounts, everything.
translation.ko: 아니, 돈만 챙기고 계좌 동결해 버려

translation.en: Even if his dog opened an account, I want you to freeze it.
translation.ko: 그놈이 키우는 개가 계좌 터도 동결해

translation.en: -What you got? -(Clatters)
Got a mobile money launderer.
Pack it up.
You coming?
No, don't go in the bank.
This is something we can actually build a case on.
Don't go in the bank, Kate!
There you go, and she's goin' in the bank.
(Kate) These are all Manuel Diaz's accounts?
(Man) Yeah. Cash deposits made daily in $9,000 increments.
-So, it doesn't have to be reported. -That's right.
And you can seize those?
I already have. And I'll go through these wire transfer numbers and
freeze all these accounts as well.
Here you go.
(Man) Oh, damn, that's smart. (Kate) What?
This is a bank line of credit.
See, you make payments over what you owe
and it doesn't show up as cash, it shows up as a negative loan balance.
translation.ko: 현금으로 뜨지 않고 대출 잔액으로 뜨죠

translation.en: It's never reported to anyone. IRS, DEA... This money is invisible.
translation.ko: 세금 신고도 없어서 들킬 일이 없어요

translation.en: How much does he have?
Take a look.
Oh, my God.
They just seized $17 million.
-It's a bogus bust, Kate. -What?
You can't prosecute it. No one controls who deposits money in an account.
An attorney will have that money back in a few months, but a lot of heads will roll before that.
translation.ko: 변호사 데리고 오면 어차피 뱉어야 해

translation.en: But we can arrest Manuel for now. We can get him off the street.
We gotta get Manuel called back to Mexico. That's the objective.
We have no jurisdiction in Mexico.
We have nothing. We need to do something now.
Can't arrest him.
(Manuel) What?
When?
Wait a minute.
$9,000 is deposited into this account every day, in cash,
for five years.
It's not illegal. It's suspect, but it isn't illegal.
I think the IRS might think it's illegal.
What do you want, Kate? What would you like done here?
I want to follow some semblance of procedure.
That's what I want. To build a prosecutable case.
We prosecuted more felony drug cases in this region last year
than in the two previous years combined.
Are you feeling that on the street?
You getting the vibe that we're winning?
No.
(Jennings) Do you?
No, sir, I don't.
Advisors like Matt come in, they stir the pot,
translation.ko: 맷 같은 전문가가 판을 휘저어 놓으면

translation.en: they cause the criminals to react and make mistakes.
That's how we build cases against the individuals
that actually make a difference in this fight.
It's when they're nervous, when they stop trusting their crews, when they move their money.
translation.ko: 놈들끼리 불신이 쌓여서 돈을 옮기는 순간

translation.en: These are all opportunities to strike.
And that's the purpose of people like Matt.
(Jennings) Kate, this isn't something that I dreamed up myself.
translation.ko: 케이트, 나도 이 상황이 탐탁지 않지만

translation.en: I don't have the authority to hire advisors
or authorise joint agency missions,
or fly agents from Air Force bases.
Are you understanding me?
These decisions are made far from here
by officials elected to office, not appointed to them.
So if your fear is operating out of bounds,
I am telling you, you are not.
The boundary's been moved.
Are we clear?
(Kate) Yes, sir.
I need a fucking drink.
-Where you wanna go? -Anywhere.
I'm gonna go get a table.
-I guess it's on me. -Thanks.
-(Bartender) What'll it be? -Two beers.
Thank you.
I want a cigarette so bad.
(Exhales) Macer?
Yeah?
I hate to go on about this,
but I think the bra situation's the least of your problems.
OK...
-Cos you look like shit. -(Laughs)
You do. You look like shit. Everybody on the team's talkin' about it.
They're like, "Kate used to be a number one draft pick.
"Now look at her. She looks like fuckin' shit."
Look at you. Your eyebrows are a mess.
No, they're not!
They're like caterpillars, like wild beasts. You're losing weight...
I'm eating.
Look at you. What is it, one T-shirt a week?
At least work on your personal hygiene, huh?
You sound like my mother.
Maybe I am your mother.
First we work on personal hygiene, then we move on to the shopping.
Get you some potatoes, yeah? Eat some food...
Where have you taken me? What is this place?
It's a bar.
It's full of cowboys.
I'm a cowboy.
You're a redneck?
I'm a redneck. Got a trailer. Got a wife.
translation.ko: 촌놈이죠 난 트레일러에서 살고 마누라도 있어요

translation.en: -(Chuckles) -What are you talking about?
I got a trailer, I got a wife. She's my sister. (Both laughing)
(Man) Big Reg.
-Ted! -What's goin' on, man?
-Long time. How you been? -(Ted) Yeah, it's good to see you, man.
(Reggie) Good to see you, too. How you been?
(Ted) Gettin' your groove on, huh?
No, man. We just started. We just got here.
All right. You, uh...
-Gonna introduce me, man? -Oh.
Ted, Phoenix PD, Kate, my partner.
translation.ko: 피닉스 경찰 테드예요 내 파트너 케이트

translation.en: How you doin'? Just Ted's fine.
I saw you play softball once.
-Softball? -(Chuckles)
(Reggie) She was at the game, Ted.
"The game"?
Aw... (Reggie) Where you struck out in slow-pitch softball.
You played really, really well.
(Ted) Yeah, I appreciate that.
I'm gonna head back to that bar now. Well, can I get y'all another round?
translation.ko: 한 병 더 해야겠어, 더 마실래요?

translation.en: -(Kate) Yeah, sure. -Cool.
All right.
Ted, he's a good guy.
Divorced.
Just give me one second, I'll be right with you.
All right...
Just wait, wait, wait a second...
What, what, what? Is that too much?
Just wait one minute. I just need a second.
All right. I'm sorry, I'm sorry.
Hey, Kate?
Hey! Hey, come here, stop, stop, talk to me.
Just talk to me. OK? Relax. OK? Just take it...
Whoa, shit! Kate...
What is it? What? Stop.
Stop. Stop.
Shit, what the fuck is wrong with you?
-Don't... -What the fuck are you...
(Groans) Goddamn!
You fuckin' try to shoot me? You fuckin' crazy?
-Stop that! -Get off me!
(Ted) Fuck that...
Damn it, Kate! Just fucking stop!
Stop!
Stop, bitch! Stop! Fuck!
Fuckin' stop!
-Stop. Shh. -(Choking)
Fuck!
This is you, you hear me? You did this. You did this.
You used me as bait.
Nah, you used yourself as bait.
I told you not to go in the bank.
You brought him back here, though. That was smart.
Yeah. Love how we're gonna pretend like I planned this.
translation.ko: 네, 누가 봐도 계획한 것 같네요

translation.en: Why don't you just write that in your report.
Come on! This is good news!
They're gonna call Manuel back soon.
Isn't that the point?
(Kate) It's OK, Reg.
I thought he was a friend. (Kate) I know.
-Want me to stay tonight? -No. I'm good.
-You sure? -I'm good.
(Ted) How y'all want me to talk to you when you keep fuckin' hittin' me?
How many other corrupt motherfuckers are you workin' with on this side of the border?
translation.ko: 뒷돈 먹은 새끼들이 얼마나 더 있지?

translation.en: All right. Look...
It's exactly what I told you, all right? They just...
They came to me and they wanted details about our case
and, yes, I did it. I gave it to them, but I never wanted anybody to get hurt.
translation.ko: 정보를 주긴 했지만 누굴 해칠 생각은 없었어

translation.en: I would never gotten involved with them pieces of shit
-if I thought that there was any... -Ahh! Fuck! OK!
translation.ko: 그 새끼들이랑 엮이는 게 아니었는데 제기랄, 알았어! 알았다니까!

translation.en: (Groans) OK! Fuck! OK!
(Matt) "OK, OK, OK," is not what we're lookin' for, Ted.
translation.ko: 알았다는 말이 듣고 싶은 게 아니야

translation.en: You know what the beauty is of you being so beat to a pulp?
translation.ko: 피투성이 되게 맞으면 뭐가 좋은지 알아?

translation.en: Cos no one's gonna notice a few more scratches.
translation.ko: 몇 군데 더 다쳐도 아무도 몰라

translation.en: This is a new deal, Ted.
I'm the one who decides whether your daughter'll get Federal protection...
translation.ko: 네 딸의 보호 신청을 해 줄 수도 있고

translation.en: (Matt) Or whether we post your ex-wife's address on the Internet.
translation.ko: 인터넷에 전처 주소를 풀어 버릴 수도 있어

translation.en: I decide whether you go to prison in a work camp in Missouri,
translation.ko: 널 편한 교도소로 보낼 수도 있고

translation.en: or a kill house like Corcoran.
This is where you negotiate how to survive, my friend.
OK. Look...
(Stammers) I feel like this whole thing's just gotten away from me...
translation.ko: 내가 감당 못 하게 일이 커졌어

translation.en: I fucked up. OK, I fucked up and I'm in over my fuckin' head right now.
I'm sorry... Ahh!
Fuck! Get it out! Get it the fuck out!
Fuck! Get it the fuck out! Get it out!
Motherfucker! And fuck you!
Fuck!
How many officers do they have working on the force?
I'll tell you everything you wanna know.
You just gotta promise me that my daughter's gonna be safe, OK?
You make me that promise.
You want the truth?
Please.
Give me all the names
of all the motherfuckers they got working on the force.
(Ted) OK, OK...
-All right? -OK...
OK. So which phone do we start with?
It's in that one. It's that shitty one.
-That's the shitty one? -Yes, sir!
(Alejandro) How you feelin'?
-Better. -Uh-huh.
Well, you should've shot him.
I just tried to have sex with my hitman.
Nah. He's no assassin.
He just wanted to know what you know.
They're after us, not you.
translation.ko: 놈들은 당신이 아니라 우릴 노리는 거니까

translation.en: Thank you.
You remind me of someone very special to me.
translation.ko: 당신을 보면 내게 특별한 누군가가 떠올라요

translation.en: Get some rest.
Tomorrow they'll call Manuel Diaz back to Mexico
and we'll cut a leg from them.
(Man 1 on radio) Hello, sixty. (Indistinct radio chatter)
(Man 2 on radio) We have eyes on the objective.
Can we get a closer visual?
Ten metres going down east of the ridge.
(Boy) Papa?
(Speaking Spanish) Eggs
With jalapeños?
Of course
Are you working today?
Tonight
Do you want to play soccer in the park?
-Football? -Sí, Papa.
(Speaking Spanish) Hand me my coffee
Alright, we'll play
No!
Never touch that
Understood?
Come on in.
Tasty beverage?
OK, boys.
(Kate) What's going on? What's the plan?
We're going hunting.
Looks like Manuel Diaz is being called back to Mexico.
Just waiting for confirmation.
There's the tunnel right there.
(Delta leader) All right, listen up.
Let's clarify the op.
We're gonna drive to location, proceed on foot...
-How are you? -Good. How are you?
-I'm fine. -How's the neck?
It's better, thank you.
Good, good.
(Delta leader) These diagrams are based on other tunnels that have been mapped.
They're for reference only, they're not accurate.
Once on the Mexican side of the border, there'll be a small staging area,
translation.ko: 멕시코 쪽 국경에 작은 초소가 있고

translation.en: then another shaft will lead to the main warehouse and the road that returns to Mexico.
translation.ko: 창고와 멕시코로 가는 땅굴이 있을 거다

translation.en: Once we clear the mules, we don't expect more than a dozen bandits.
No. They use Mexican police for vehicle transport.
If you see a uniform in the tunnel, consider him a bandit, too.
OK. Uh, you want to discuss ROE?
-Nah, we'll save that for later. -OK.
This is an in and out. We're clearing, placing an agent.
It's all about creating a diversion.
(Matt) Want the mother of all diversions, boys.
Need a lot of noise. Fourth of July on steroids. (Delta team laughing)
translation.ko: 독립기념일 뺨 후려치게 시끄럽게 만들어 봐

translation.en: (Delta leader) All right. Weapons check. Let's go, boys.
This looks like confirmation.
-I need to fit your guy with a locator. -Yeah, do it.
(Reggie) Those are Special Ops. Are we going in on this?
Nah. You guys aren't really dressed for it.
Well, you didn't fuckin' tell us.
Yeah, well, you two went cryin' to Daddy yesterday, and we
-don't want Daddy to know everything. -Oh, give me a fucking break!
translation.ko: 어제 둘이서 징징대길래 - 사정 봐준 거야 - 어이가 없어서

translation.en: All right, we'll get you some extra gear.
(Kate) We have tac gear in the car.
You guys will hang back when we get there, OK?
Then why are we going?
Cos CIA can't operate within US borders...
(Both) Without a domestic agency attached.
I told you you'd be useful.
So that's it. That's why I'm here.
(Matt) Yeah, that's it.
That's why you're here.
Hey, we find any drugs, you guys get to confiscate 'em.
It's gonna be a big day.
Un-fucking real!
-Front and back. -Kate.
Kate, come on. Fuck these people, man. They've been using us from the beginning.
We don't have to do this.
I need to know what they used us for.
-Doesn't matter what! -Yes, it does!
I say we walk. We walk and make them eat this whole fucked-up operation.
translation.ko: 우린 빠져요 어디 엿 먹어 보라지

translation.en: No. I have to know.
(Man on radio) Black Mercedes... Plate number, Romeo-India-November
three-one-Bravo-seven. Heading south by southeast.
translation.ko: 검정 벤츠, 번호판 RIN31B7 남동쪽으로 이동 중

translation.en: (Matt) Where?
-OK. -(Mobile phone beeps)
We gotta hit the tunnel the minute we get on the ground.
Pretty exciting, huh?
(Matt) What is target's location?
(Man on radio) 14 miles south of Nogales heading west, rapidly.
translation.ko: 노갈레스 남쪽 23킬로미터 서쪽으로 빠르게 이동 중

translation.en: Keep your fuckin' safeties on, barrels pointed down.
translation.ko: 댁들은 안전장치 걸고 총구 내리고 있어요

translation.en: Stay in the back.
Don't shoot anyone on my fuckin' team. Right?
(Delta leader) Gear check?
Thermal camera, check.
Night vision goggles, check.
(Delta 1) Get those guys.
(Delta leader) Wanna take Alpha squad, I'll take B squad?
-You got it. Let's do it. -(Delta leader) Let's go, boys.
(Delta leader) Control, you copy?
(Man on radio) Roger, Alpha. We read.
(Man on radio) Fifty meters. Your three o'clock, Alpha.
(Delta leader on radio) Stand by. Getting close to objective.
(Man on radio) Alpha, Bravo, be advised. 12 metres straight ahead.
(Matt) All right, we need to boogie and we need to do it quiet till we find the centre.
(Alejandro) Draw the fighters to you and make some noise.
translation.ko: 몇 명 데리고 가서 시끄럽게 만들어

translation.en: Don't follow me. I'll be fine.
(Delta leader) What are the rules of engagement?
(Matt) Weapons free, my friend. Weapons free.
translation.ko: - 무기 자유 사용 - 무기 자유 사용

translation.en: (Delta leader) Weapons free, boys.
(Matt) Good luck.
-You OK? -My gun!
Leave it. Stay on my six.
(Speaking Spanish)
Help me out!
Let's get out of here
Come on!
(Speaking Spanish) Let's go Give me the keys
-Give me the keys! -Calm down
(Gunshot)
(Speaking Spanish) Hands in the air
Turn around
(Speaking Spanish) Medellín?
(In English) Freeze!
Step away from him.
(Alejandro) Put that down.
I mean it! Move away from him right now!
Don't ever point a weapon at me again. (Gasps)
Catch your breath. Then get back up there.
(Speaking Spanish) Both hands on the steering wheel
I am through. Do you have my location?
(Man on radio) Roger, we have you.
Target is east and north of you.
Looks like Highway 56 to 17. Will intercept him if he stays on 17.
Go east on 56 off Highway 2.
Wilco.
(Both speaking Spanish) What's your name?
Silvio.
You're going to exit onto highway 56
I have a son
What you do now is for your family
(Matt) Is he through yet?
(Man on radio) We have joy.
GPS is transmitting. Audio is transmitting.
Should intercept in 20.
(Matt) That was a clean, clean fucking op, my friend.
(Delta leader) Except for these two assholes.
Well, you're better overseas. You don't have to babysit.
Where's Kate?
I thought she was with you.
We gotta go back.
Oh, shit. Boys, we're missin' one. Let's go.
-(Delta 1) Whoa, whoa! -(Grunts)
Just lay back, baby. Let it happen.
Stop. Stop moving.
(Grunts) Get off me!
Stop moving! Stop!
Stop it.
Just relax. Just relax.
All right? You gonna stay there?
Are you gonna stay there?
All right.
Now, you listen.
You went up the wrong tunnel.
You saw things you shouldn't have seen.
translation.ko: 보지 말아야 할 걸 봤단 얘기지

translation.en: What is Medellín?
(Matt) Medellín?
Medellín refers to a time
when one group controlled every aspect of the drug trade,
providing a measure of order that we could control.
translation.ko: 시장 질서가 잡히고 CIA의 통제가 먹혔지

translation.en: And until somebody finds a way to convince 20% of the population
to stop snorting and smoking that shit,
order's the best we can hope for.
And what you saw up there
was Alejandro working toward returning that order.
(Kate) Alejandro works for the fucking Colombian Cartel.
He works for the competition.
Alejandro works for anyone
who will point him toward the people who made him.
translation.ko: 복수할 기회만 준다면 어디든 붙는 거지

translation.en: Us.
Them.
Anyone who will turn him loose.
translation.ko: 재갈을 풀어 줄 주인을 찾던 거야

translation.en: So he can get the person that cut off his wife's head,
and threw his daughter into a vat of acid.
translation.ko: 딸을 염산 통에 던져 넣은 놈을 잡을 수 있으니

translation.en: Yeah.
That's what we're dealing with.
You can't do this.
You can't.
I'm sure as shit not the person you're gonna hide it all behind.
You need to just take a breath.
I'm gonna fuckin' talk.
-No, you're not. -Yeah.
I'm gonna tell everyone what you did.
That would be a major mistake.
Is that the target up ahead? Confirm.
(Man on radio) Roger that. Black Mercedes, 60 metres ahead.
(Speaking Spanish) Accelerate
Turn on your lights
You're going to pull over that car
(Manuel) This motherfucker...
(Speaking Spanish) Very good
Use the speaker
Tell him to get out of the car
Leave the car
Again
Get out, asshole!
(Alejandro speaking Spanish) Tell him to raise his jacket and turn around
translation.ko: 재킷 들어 올리고 뒤로 돌라고 해

translation.en: (Silvio speaking Spanish) Raise your jacket and turn around
(Speaking Spanish) You know who I am?
(Alejandro speaking) Tell him you'll kill him if he doesn't
I'll kill you, motherfucker!
Raise your jacket and turn around
(Alejandro speaking) Tell him to lose the gun
(Silvio speaking) Drop the gun
What a good police officer you make, Silvio
Now exit the car
Exit the car, Silvio
What do you want?
(Alejandro speaking) Don't move, motherfucker
(Manuel speaking) Do you know who I am?
I am a jefe!
Lay down!
(Alejandro speaking) I know who you are
-You're Manuel Diaz -(Grunts)
But right now you're the guy who's going to take me
to meet your jefe
Get up!
If you try anything, your daughters will be violated by 20 men
Turn around!
Get in
(Manuel speaking Spanish)
(Guard speaking Spanish) I know who you are
(In English) What happens when we get to the house?
You'll stop the car, I'll get out.
What will happen to me?
Slow down.
Señor Diaz?
(Man on radio) Six remain.
We're going blind.
(Alejandro speaking Spanish) Bon appétit
Stay calm
or we're dead
(Alejandro speaking) Do your children speak English?
Then we will speak English
Eat, eat!
(In English) Every night you have families killed.
And yet, here you dine.
Tonight should be no different.
(Speaking Spanish) Eat
Do you think the people that sent you here
are any different?
Who do you think we learned it from?
The grieving lawyer.
Your wife, you think she'd be proud of what you've become?
translation.ko: 네 부인이 지금 네 모습을 보면 자랑스러워할까?

translation.en: Don't forget about my daughter.
Ah, sí.
(Speaking Spanish) Your little girl
It wasn't personal
For me it is
(In English) Not in front of my boys.
Time to meet God
(In English) Go ahead and finish your meal.
(Alejandro) I would recommend not standing on balconies for a while, Kate.
Sit down.
You look like a little girl when you're scared.
You remind me of the daughter they took away from me.
translation.ko: 당신을 보면 놈들에게 빼앗긴 딸이 생각나요

translation.en: I need you to sign this piece of paper.
It basically says that everything we did
was done by the book.
I can't sign that.
Sign it.
It's OK.
I can't sign that.
You would be committing suicide, Kate.
Come on. Sign it.
You should move to a small town,
where the rule of law still exists.
-You will not survive here. -(Clatters)
You are not a wolf.
And this is the land of wolves now.
